description: From New Latin Physalis, coined by Linnaeus from Ancient Greek φυσαλλίς (phusallís, “bladder, wind instrument”), from φυσιόω (phusióō, “to puff up, blow up”), φυσώ (phusṓ).

entries.meaning: Any plant of the genus Physalis.
The fruit of such a plant, a yellow-orange berry, typically firm in texture with a mild, refreshing acidity.
